title: What should I write about in my college essay if nothing bad has happened in my life? - Quora

response.answer_text: Bad Stuff That Happened is not the only fodder for college essays. If it were, college classes would look a lot different insofar as they would be filled with students who had suffered some misfortune. My suggestion is that you change your starting point. Do not think about something that happened to you or something you did. Think about personal qualities and core values that admissions officers need to know if they are going to “get” you. From there, find a story or episodes from your life that reveal your quality. For a longer explanation, check out an article I posted on my blog, which walks you through a couple of steps. Here is a link: Expert Help For College Admissions Essays

There are several approaches that you can use. Write about volunteering or activities you were involved in. Write about your family or your first job. Find something that connects you as a person to the evaluator. You don’t need to have a tragic story per se, but a way of making a connection.
